column4: ffmpegthumbnailer comes to mind ... have you already tried something?
ffmpegthumbnailer yeah lil hard to use i was trying to install thumbnail me but wont install
where did you get thumbnail package? can't find it in ubuntu 12.04 .. also wondering if you're looking for a standalone thumbnailer or to get it with nautilus or any other file manager you use
i got it from here http://www.thumbnailme.com/ its not in ubuntu 12.04 download it its a deb
looking around there, i'll report back in a minute
ok thanks
i tested the 64bit version, installed ok here (and it works) .. did you get any error messages while installing? and you have the correct .deb for your system (32bit or 64bit)?
i useing ubuntu 12.04 64bits let me see if am useing the correct .deb
no i am useing the i386 deb lol were did you find the 64bit one
heh, it's on the site, you need to click the x64 folder
will check right now

http://netcologne.dl.sourceforge.net/project/thumbnailme/Linux/Debian/x64/Thumbnailme_2.1_amd64.deb in case you missed it (i have seriously customized my browser, so i might have another 'view' on that page as yourself)
its not working for me caues the i386 is install but not working am now i cant install the 64 bits one how would i remove the i386 one useing terminal
'sudo apt-get purge thumbnailme' to get rid of the i386 one and 'sudo dpkg -i <path/to/64bit.deb>' to try with the 64bit
that to remove program or install program i need to remove
you double-clicked when installing the first time i guess, it's easier to see any installation problems from commandline with that second one
am getting this here
take it from the top ... first: sudo apt-get purge thumbnailme

no worries, let us know when you are ready to install the 64bit version .. it's crucial in this step to feed the command with the exact path of Thumbnailme_2.1_amd64.deb, otherwise it will not find it .. that's the logic
ok, as example .. 'sudo dpkg -i $HOME/Desktop/Thumbnailme_2.1_amd64.deb' will try to install it if you downloaded it to ~/Desktop .. the $HOME is a shortcut to your home/<username> ..
do you know where you downloaded it?
did you install useing deb install software
thumbnailme? yes i tried the .deb .. still having issues?
got it install and everything working fine now thanks for your help
